newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek bourse off 6.35 pct on profit-taking,Albania.
newsitem.headline: Greek bourse off 6.35 pct on profit-taking,Albania.

text.p: The Athens bourse was hit by a barrage of sell orders and fell 6.35 percent in 40 minutes on changes of sentiment, profit-taking and worries about developments Albania, dealers said.

"We are under selling pressure," said Costas Panagidis, managing director at Axon Securities. "The market sentiment has changed for the worse, there is profit-taking from institutionals. Developments in Albania are a minor factor."
The general share index was down 7.21 percent to 1209,69 points on 19.85 million shares traded.
The banking sector was down 8.0 percent, hitting the eight percent daily volatility limit. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
